sentence.idiomatic: She grows a lot of flowers.
Our family has a dog, it's really cute.
I can earn my own money, I don't need you to support me.
I heard that the cherry blossoms in the park are in bloom. Let's go have a look.
When does this kind of a flower bloom?
The air in the room isn't very good, could you open the window?
You just need to answer true or false, that's good enough.
Actually, all he needs to do is give me an apology and I will forgive him.
When you see a dog, as long as you don't move, he won't bite you.
It's too cold inside. I want to go out and get some sun.
I'll take the clothes out on the balcony to dry in the sun.
It's so sunny outside, aren't you afraid of getting a suntan?
Making this dish is such a pain. You have to prepare so many ingredients.
It's such a pain going shopping with girls.
Do you think having a pet is troublesome?
Last winter was especially cold.
She particularly hates math class.
She is terribly afraid of caterpillars.
Ouch! You stepped on my foot.
Yesterday I stomped on a cockroach and killed it.
Be careful, don't step on the banana peel!
Wow, you have so many flowers! They're so beautiful!
Wait until the spring flowers bloom, and it will be even more beautiful!
Keeping a garden must be a lot of hard work.
It's all right, as long as you water it, have sunlight, and fertilize it's enough.
I did that before, but all the flowers died.
No way? Growing flowers is quite easy.
I think it's a bit of a pain. Plus there are so many bugs. It's so dirty!
My garden is very clean, there are no bugs. Ah! A caterpillar! Squish it! Squish it!
